definition: medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media

sentences.english: I agree to go on a blind date as the matchmaker is my best friend.
sentences.chinese: 我同意去相親，因爲媒人是我最好的朋友。

sentences.english: In ancient times, matchmakers held sway over who should marry whom.
sentences.chinese: 古代的時候，中國人的婚姻是由媒人撮合的。

sentences.english: Matchmakers used to be very important to wedding plans.
sentences.chinese: 媒人曾在婚禮的規劃上佔有舉足輕重的角色。

sentences.english: Today, I found out that my wife had an affair with our marriage counselor. FML
sentences.chinese: 今天我發現我老婆跟我們的媒人有一腿。

sentences.english: The school also serves as match-maker between the gold and diggers.
sentences.chinese: 這所學校還充當了有錢人和拜金女的媒人。

sentences.english: You are a very bad match-maker.
sentences.chinese: 你是一個很不高明的媒人。

sentences.english: The matchmaker shows Han Bear a picture of Miss Ladybug.
sentences.chinese: 媒人婆給憨熊看了張花大姐的照片。

sentences.english: I am a professional matchmaker, and here's what I know
sentences.chinese: 我是一個職業媒人，在此把我所知傾囊相送。

sentences.english: Mitelman's a kind of financial matchmaker .
sentences.chinese: 米特爾曼是一種財務媒人。

sentences.english: North Korean women, says Choi, desire the automatic acceptance and stability a South Korean husband offers.
sentences.chinese: 媒人崔英姬說，朝鮮姑娘需要韓國小夥的包容和穩定。

sentences.english: Matchmakers are all usually old women.
sentences.chinese: 媒人經常是一些上了年紀的女人。

definition: to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
to bring together/to mediate/to arrange a deal
blind date/arranged interview to evaluate a proposed marriage partner (Taiwan pr. [xiang4 qin1])/to be deeply attached to each other
